body: @idiotperson yeah i'm confused as fuck! so what's the conclusion? she was not a virgin?

translation has a similar line, but in the context of that translation, it makes no sense. Page 20 of the other translation leads one to believe that she has also never had sex, but then this line completely contradicts that. At the end, we have some reincorporation, where Adachi says that she fell in love with someone 6 years younger than her.  In the other translation, it proves that the line about 6 older people confessing to her is a mistranslation, as at the end she says "Even though 6 younger people fell in love with me before".  In some places, the other translation feels a bit more naturally spoken, but is overall the inferior translation.

After comparing both translations, I think this one is the better one.  They are mostly the same, but they have some notable differences. On page 4 in this one, Takechi talks about how he decided when they first met, he decided he won't confess to someone 6 years older than him. But in the other one, that translator renders it as Takechi saying when he first met her, he heard that 6 older people confessed to her. On page 20 in this one, Adachi says "Doing it... in a place like this" to which Takechi says "even Adachi has her first time" (saying she has had sex before, unrelated to what Adachi said right before), where as the other translation has her say "Doing it... it's for the first time for me" to which Takechi says "Even for you, Adachi... it's the first time...", implying they are both losing their virginities. This translation on that page that this one uses leads to Adachi saying "have you heard about my first time?" (confirming that she isn't a virgin), and the other

@02MOKASA I'm pretty sure it's the boy saying "Because it's my first time", as you can see a heart in the statement "have you heard about my first time", and a heart in the message usually means that it is the girl saying it.  The other translation (though seemingly less accurate, however) seems to corroborate this.

The poor grammar tag is part of the problem with the way Nhentai works. The original upload on e-hentai was tagged with it, but the uploader, to their credit, went back and corrected most of the errors. However, they didn't upload a new gallery, just replaced the images in the existing one, do the tags carried over, including the 'poor grammar'one. That tag has been voted down on the e-hentai gallery. But, since Nhentai's code/script doesn't check tags very often, the now incorrect tag is still there.

Tl;dr Nhentai's code a shit.
